intro: Hoffmannseggella × meyeriana, commonly known as the hybrid holly. It is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States, characterized by its spiny leaves and bright red berries. The plant belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. The berries are a food source for various birds and wildlife.
